welcome.intro: Hi! I am a software developer, thinker, designer.

title.welcome: Hi there! My name is Akinyele

graduation.title: Graduation!
graduation.when: Diploma will be received in March 2021. Graduation expected in June 2021

why.stat1: I strive create engineering solutions to make people's lives run smoothly, without glitch and well-designed.
why.stat2: Personally, I believe in effortless, and this led me to study Software Engineering.

kaizen.stat1: I am fascinated by the philosophy of continuous improvement or Kaizen, as I learnt during my 8-month COOP internship in Japan, where I was immersed in the cradle of technology combined with efficiency.

life.motto: "Make it better" is my personnal motto.
life.stat1: I apply that in virtually every aspect of my life - when I bake, play drums, ride my bike or connect with people.

experiences.languages: I speak, read and write French, English and Japanese fluently and I design software solutions, from ideation to implementation. I am also quite comfortable with undertaking work-in-progress and get involved at any stage of development.
experiences.skills: I have experience in e-commerce retail, telecommunications and gaming.

paragraph.outro: Let's make your next project happen!

experience.1: Refined critical backend/frontend software by writing quality code affecting hundreds of thousands of customers.
experience.2: Acquired a high impact attitude by making quick and great decisions.
experience.3: Nurtured communication skills by asking the right questions to the right people.
experience.4: Contributed to open source projects for the first time.

experience.1: Responsible for maintaining a Ruby on Rails MySQL administration tool used by over 1000 engineers.
experience.2: Ensured stability for front-end / back-end with integration and unit testing.
experience.3: Front-end was improved to keep the same look & feel and giving it a more modern touch, making it easier to use.

experience.1: Assigned to a Unity 3D project where visualizing 3G and 4G network spectrums was the key for optimizing implementation for the upcoming 5G cellular networks in Canada.
experience.2: Requirements, prototypes and the final proof of concept were presented to the CEO and their colleagues.

experience.1: Ensured reliability of security systems by introducing a certification protocol on legacy software
experience.2: Stand-alone proprietary client-side application for creating more secure SSL certificates.
experience.3: Implemented software patterns to ensure maintainability of software.

bot.title: Github Discord Bot (2020)
bot.description: A personal Github assistant on Discord
bot.text: Designed and built to work with a Github organization for managing pull requests directly on Discord. I used Github's latest GraphQL API for cleaner management of queries and mutations.

misete.title: Misete.io (2020)
misete.description: A sharing site for watching and sharing Nintendo Switch clips.
misete.text: This site has several components: the site itself, backed by Sidekiq-operated background jobs, a separate authentication system and an internal GraphQL API used for fetching large quantities of data.

tanoshimu.title: YourAnime.moe [Formerly Tanoshimu] (2016)
tanoshimu.text: This is my first full-fledged website. This was originally designed for anime streaming but I then decided not to host anything due to legal reasons. I have developed a separate admin dashboard for managing content on the site. My focus was on providing top-notch user experience. I also wrote my own HTML5 video player.

notaki.title: Notaki.ca (2017)
notaki.description: A note-taking app targeted at students.
notaki.text: Originally a prototype for a graded academic project. I then completed the application on my own. I implemented extra features such as: automatic saving, generating PDFs and theme personalization. The next step is to further improve user experience and re-implement the front end in React.

crystal_clear.title: CrystalClear.ca (2018)
crystal_clear.text: This idea is still in progress, so I cannot publicly disclose any information about it. Let's say that you can share with your special someone some info about yourself.

capstone.title: Smart Building Apps - Capstone Project (2019)
capstone.description: Manage your rent payments with this simple yet powerful dashboard.
capstone.text: This is the final academic project for my bachelor's degree of Applied Science in Software Engineering. The goal is to allow residents to pay their rent through an online dashboard. They will be able to track their payments, get alerts for upcoming payments and see their unit/lease information. Property managers are able to manage users and lease information.

hon_site.title: Akinyele.ca - This website (2019)
hon_site.description: A more modern approach to my showing my potential.
hon_site.text: A 2019 version of my website. After learning React at Shopify, I decided to learn more of this technology and I am very happy with the results. Of course, lots of aspects need to be improved, but I care very much about progress.

tanoshimu.title: Tanoshimu (Android version) (2017)
tanoshimu.description: A private streaming anime website... on your Android device.
tanoshimu.text: This is a mobile version of Have Fun (Tanoshimu). I primarily made this application to improve my anime website's mobile experience.

spectrum.title: 3D Spectrum Visualization (2017)
spectrum.text: This is the project I worked on during my Fall 2017 COOP term. This application built on Unity explores a new way to visualize spectrum in 3D, from scratch.

decode.title: deCODE Hackathon 2017 (Shopify)
decode.description: Allow merchants to give away products using Shopify's technologies.
decode.text: I participated to last year's deCODE Hackathon in Ottawa (2017). This application was designed for sellers to give away products of their choice, share a link to participants and let them enter the contest. Once the giveaway is over, a winner is automatically selected to receive the prize.

tanoshimu_admin.title: Have Fun Admin console (for Tanoshimu) (2016)
tanoshimu_admin.text: Designed to manage the application described above. I log in as an administrator and start managing my anime website's contents.

french.title: French Akinyele (2017)
french.text: I made this website for a friend who I started tutoring. I thought we were using too much paper, so I decided to make a quick Bootstrap website.

ctgs.title: CTGS (Conference Travel Grant System) (2017)
ctgs.description: Apply for grands and bursaries for travelling.
ctgs.text: Final project for my "Software Architecture" class at university. This app is a Grant Management System where users can signup under a supervisor. A user may apply for a grant by filling the application. The latter may be granted, rejected or set pending by the supervisor.

reviews.title: Akinoid Reviews (2015)
reviews.description: Read reviews... on just about anything.
reviews.text: My first complex website yet. Its primary use is to read movie/anime/video games critiques.

bra.title: Bank Royale d'Aki 2.0 (2015)
bra.text: My first Android application. I wanted an application where I can keep my custom banking in a secure way. A web version exists as well. This is my first Ruby on Rails application.

not-found.title: This page does not exist - Akinyele.ca
not-found.statement: It seems like we weren't able to find the page you were looking for.
